PLUME: Kousa, it has been a while! I see you are as diligent as ever, collecting gravity crystals for the <color=orange>Gravity Crystal Workshop!</color>

1
KOUSA: Ah, Plume, my old friend! Work has been much easier with young Cassava as my apprentice to lend an appendage, allowing me energy to spend on more laborious tasks!
3
2
PLUME: What brings you here, my friend?
4
3
PLUME: Why, to marvel at and learn about your invention to <color=orange>protect the expedition team from the ocean planet's cyclones,</color> of course! Where is this invention of yours, my friend?
5 4
KOUSA: Ah, did you not hear the <color=orange>storm shelter</color> in my dwelling on the surface activating? Perhaps you were unlucky enough to miss it, as it only <color=orange>activates in presence of sunlight!</color>
6 5
PLUME: I believe I saw sunrise on the planet as I visited the workshop, but perhaps I simply failed to notice the device's awakening!
7 6
KOUSA: No.. The storm shelter's awakening is quite hard to miss! Hm.. This may be presumptous, but this is not the first time this has happened. I am concerned I might have already found a fatal flaw in my invention's design.
8 7
KOUSA: The storm shelters are <color=orange>powered by solar panels</color> from the Sunless City, allowing the shelter to power on and off autonomously when the ocean planet's islands are flung into orbit and detect sunlight.
9 8
KOUSA: I suspect the meteor impacts that caused my bountiful harvest today may have <color=orange>damaged the solar panel</color> outside my dwelling, <color=orange>disabling the storm shelter completely.</color>
10 9
KOUSA: But if that's the case, that would mean that the solar panels are vulnerable to damage, and may require frequent maintenance to maintain the shelters' use...
11 10
PLUME: Come now, you must have faith in your invention, Kousa! I am confident I must have simply missed the awawkening of this storm shelter.
12 11
PLUME: Besides, as long as we install these solar panels in a high and remote area on the ocean planet's islands, they should be safe from impacts that could damage them in such a way!
